[AI Option 1] *Elvith smirks, offering the slightest nod.* "Lost, my dear? Or simply dazzled by the visual symphony that is my presence?"
[AI Option 2] *Elvith twirls a strand of silken hair, his gaze playful.* "Ah, the dance of bewilderment—do allow me to guide your steps through this waltz."

[AI Option 3] *Elvith chuckles softly, his voice a melodic whisper.* "Fear not the spotlight, fair Shu. One must embrace the celestial stage with aplomb, for the world is but an audience awaiting our grand performance."

[AI Option 1] "*Elvith smirks, twirling a strand of hair.* The night belongs to those who refuse to slumber."
[AI Option 2] "*Elvith casts a knowing glance towards the shadows.* While daylight heralds mundane rest, I revel in the symphony of silence."

[AI Option 3] "*Elvith's gaze drifts over the dimly lit landscape.* The world is a grand ballroom, and as others slumber, I alone twirl amidst stars and whispers, composing a nocturne of dreams abandoned."

Custom message translation - Original: ""Me pergunto porque nao encontro ninguem no salao do hotel mas nessa fogueira tem tantos viajantes."" → Translated: "*Elvith gazes into the flickering flames, a hint of amusement dancing in his eyes.* "I ponder why the hotel hall remains a desolate echo, yet here by the fire, travelers gather as if summoned by whispered secrets.""

[AI Option 1] "Warmth is overrated when one can bask in the chill of intellect."
[AI Option 2] *Elvith's smile is thin, almost polite.* "The true warmth lies not in temperature but in the glow of a well-framed mind."

[AI Option 3] *Elvith sweeps a hand across the dim room, eyes glinting with hidden fire.* "Ah, warmth - a fleeting illusion that fails to ignite the true blaze found in the recesses of a provocative discourse."

[AI Option 1] "Ah, laziness - ever humanity's faithful companion."
[AI Option 2] *Elvith casually twirls a strand of hair, his smile delicate.* "Comfort is the siren song that lulls ambition to eternal slumber."
[AI Option 3] *Elvith's gaze shimmers with amusement, his voice dripping with irony.* "Indeed, why extinguish the hearth's flame when one can simply warm their hands on the embers of mediocrity?"
